Hi everybody,

While writing a GUI for Heritrix in Python, I stumbled acros=
s some strange behaviour of Heritrix. I am using Heritrix-3.1.2-SNAPSHOT (1=
9/07/2013) and the module 'requests'. The code below is an API call in Pyth=
on, following the 'Heritrix 3.x API Guide'. When I execute the code Heritri=
x returns a 401, but the job is added to the job directory. Which is odd, r=
ight? Or did I miss something? 

Best,

Steffen Fritz



<snip>
1. user =3D=
 "alice" 
2. passwd =3D "bob"
3. baseurl =3D "https://something"
4. job_nam=
e =3D "else"
5.
6. payload =3D {'action':'build'}
7. url =3D baseurl + '/en=
gine/job/' + job_name
8. ret =3D requests.post(url, auth=3DHTTPDigestAuth(u=
ser, passwd), data=3Dpayload, verify=3DFalse)
9.
10. print(ret) # returns 4=
01
</snip>
